正文部分（body paragraphs）—围绕主题开展叙述、讨论。结尾部分（concluding paragraphs）— 对全文进行总结和概括。
而开头段(opening paragraph)中简单介绍First and Last man这本书提出的一种观念——What is called the present time is no more th.
3）结尾段（Concluding Paragraph）：对全文归纳总结。一般可采用以下四种方式对全文进行归纳：a．简明归纳全文；b．回顾主题…

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 15th cent.: from French paragraphe, via medieval Latin from Greek paragraphos 'short stroke marking a break in sense', from para- 'beside' + graphein 'write'

entry.def: A paragraph is a section of a piece of writing. A paragraph always begins on a new line and contains at least one sentence.

example.ex: The length of a paragraph depends on the information it conveys...
example.tran: 段落的长度取决于它所传达的信息。

example.ex: Paragraph 81 sets out the rules that should apply if a gift is accepted.
example.tran: 第81节列出了接受礼物后应该遵循的规定。

means.word_mean: 1. one of several distinct subdivisions of a text intended to separate ideas; the beginning is usually marked by a new indented line
1. divide into paragraphs, as of text;

sentences.sentence: "All her friends were paragraphed in last Monday's paper"

means.word_mean: 3. write paragraphs; work as a paragrapher
